page.title: 11SCHOOL HOUSE
page.content: {SCHOOL HOUSE AT WINESTEAD} The school house built originally as a "Dame School" with one room upstairs and one room downstairs was later extended to be used solely for housing the Head Teacher when Winestead School was built next door. Eventually the school closed as did many smaller local schools and all children were sent to the school at Patrington. The school house, standing in 1/3 acre of ground was purchased in 1984 by the present owner who had retired as Headmaster from Patrington School. Extensive alterations internally and additions externally were made although the character of the house remained unchanged. When renovating the dining room (which was the original downstairs room in the "Dames School") 4 chimneys were discovered, each behind the other also 4 ceilings.
